section.title: Installing &o_sharefs;
section.para: The &ostack; Shared File Systems service (&o_sharefs;) provides file storage to a virtual machine. The Shared File Systems service provides a storage provisioning control plane for shared or distributed file systems. The service enables management of share types and share snapshots if you have a driver that supports them.
The &o_sharefs; service consists of the following components:

These &o_sharefs; components are included in example &productname; models based on &o_comp; KVM, such as entry-scale-kvm, entry-scale-kvm-mml, and mid-scale-kvm. General installation instructions are available at .
If you modify one of these cloud models to set up a dedicated &clm;, add manila-client item to the list of service components for the &clm; cluster.
The following steps install &o_sharefs; if it is not already present in your cloud data model:

section.title: Configure NetaApp &o_sharefs; Back-end

note.para: An account with cluster administrator privileges must be used with the netapp_login option when using Share Server management. Share Server management creates Storage Virtual Machines (SVM), thus SVM administrator privileges are insufficient.
There are two modes for the NetApp &o_sharefs; back-end:

listitem.para: driver_handles_share_servers = False This value must be set to False if you want the driver to operate without managing share servers.

note.para: More information is available from NetApp OpenStack

section.para: The steps to configure a NetApp &o_sharefs; back-end are:

step.para: Configure a back-end in the &o_sharefs; configuration file, following the directions and comments in the file.
Commit your configuration to the local Git repo.
step.screen: &prompt.ardana;cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible &prompt.ardana;git add -A &prompt.ardana;git commit -m "My config or other commit message"

note.para: After the manila-share service has been initialized with a backend, it can be controlled independently of manila-api by using the playbooks manila-share-start.yml, manila-share-stop.yml, and manila-share-status.yml.

section.title: Configure CephFS &o_sharefs; Backend
section.para: Configure a back-end in the &o_sharefs; configuration file, ~/openstack/my_cloud vi config/manila/manila.conf.j2.

step.para: To define a CephFS native back-end, create a section like the following:
step.screen: [cephfsnative1] driver_handles_share_servers = False share_backend_name = CEPHFSNATIVE1 share_driver = manila.share.drivers.cephfs.driver.CephFSDriver cephfs_conf_path = /etc/ceph/ceph.conf cephfs_protocol_helper_type = CEPHFS cephfs_auth_id = manila cephfs_cluster_name = ceph cephfs_enable_snapshots = False

step.para: Edit the enabled_share_backends option in the DEFAULT section to point to the driverâ€™s back-end section name.
According to the environment, modify back-end specific lines in ~/openstack/my_cloud vi config/manila/manila.conf.j2.
Commit your configuration to the local Git repo.
step.screen: &prompt.ardana;cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible &prompt.ardana;git add -A &prompt.ardana;git commit -m "My config or other commit message"

note.para: After the manila-share service has been initialized with a back-end, it can be controlled independently of manila-api by using the playbooks manila-share-start.yml, manila-share-stop.yml, and manila-share-status.yml.

section.para: For more details of the CephFS &o_sharefs; back-end, see OpenStack CephFS driver.

section.title: Creating &o_sharefs; Shares
section.para: &o_sharefs; can support two modes, with and without the handling of share servers. The mode depends on driver support.
Mode 1: The back-end is a generic driver, driver_handles_share_servers = False (DHSS is disabled). The following example creates a VM using &o_sharefs; share image.

step.screen: &prompt.ardana;wget http://tarballs.openstack.org/manila-image-elements/images/manila-service-image-master.qcow2 &prompt.ardana;. service.osrc;openstack image create --name "manila-service-image-new" \ --file manila-service-image-master.qcow2 --disk-format qcow2 \ --container-format bare --visibility public --progress &prompt.ardana;openstack image list (verify manila image) &prompt.ardana;openstack security group create manila-security-group \ --description "Allows web and NFS traffic to manila server." &prompt.ardana;openstack security group rule create manila-security-group \ --protocol tcp --dst-port 2049 &prompt.ardana;openstack security group rule create manila-security-group \ --protocol udp --dst-port 2049 &prompt.ardana;openstack security group rule create manila-security-group \ --protocol tcp --dst-port 22 &prompt.ardana;openstack security group rule create manila-security-group \ --protocol icmp &prompt.ardana;openstack security group rule list manila-security-group (verify manila security group) &prompt.ardana;openstack keypair create --public-key ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub mykey &prompt.ardana;openstack network create n1 &prompt.ardana;openstack subnet create s1 --network n1 --subnet-range 11.11.11.0/24 &prompt.ardana;openstack router create r1 &prompt.ardana;openstack router add subnet r1 s1 &prompt.ardana;openstack router set r1 ext-net &prompt.ardana;openstack network list &prompt.ardana;openstack server create manila-vm --flavor m1.small \ --image IMAGE_ID --nic net-id=N1_ID --security-group manila-security-group \ --key-name myKey &prompt.ardana;oenstack floating ip create EXT-NET_ID &prompt.ardana;openstack server add floating ip manila-vm EXT-NET_ID

step.para: Validate your ability to ping or connect by SSH to manila-vm with credentials manila/manila.

step.screen: service_instance_name_or_id = MANILA_VM_ID service_net_name_or_ip = MANILA_VM_FLOATING_IP tenant_net_name_or_ip = MANILA_VM_FLOATING_IP

step.para: Create a share type. OpenStack docs has detailed instructions. Use the instructions for manila type-create default_share_type False
Restart &o_sharefs; services and verify they are up.

step.screen: &prompt.ardana;manila create NFS 1 --name SHARE &prompt.ardana;manila list (status will change from creating to available) &prompt.ardana;manila show share1 &prompt.ardana;manila access-allow SHARE ip INSTANCE_IP

step.para: Mount the share on a Compute instance

section.para: Mode 2: The back-end is NetApp, driver_handles_share_servers = True (DHSS is enabled). Procedure for driver_handles_share_servers = False is similar to Mode 1.

step.screen: share_driver = manila.share.drivers.netapp.common.NetAppDriver driver_handles_share_servers = True share_backend_name=backendNetApp netapp_login=NetApp_USERNAME netapp_password=NetApp_PASSWORD netapp_server_hostname=NETAPP_HOSTNAME netapp_root_volume_aggregate=AGGREGATE_NAME

step.para: Create a &o_sharefs; share image and verify it
step.screen: &prompt.ardana;wget http://tarballs.openstack.org/manila-image-elements/images/manila-service-image-master.qcow2 &prompt.ardana;. service.osrc;openstack image create manila-service-image-new \ --file manila-service-image-master.qcow2 --disk-format qcow2 \ --container-format bare --visibility public --progress &prompt.ardana;openstack image list (verify a &o_sharefs; image)

step.para: Create a share type. OpenStack docs has detailed instructions. Use the instructions for manila type-create default_share_type True .

step.screen: &prompt.ardana;systemctl restart openstack-manila-api openstack-manila-share \openstack-manila-scheduler &prompt.ardana;manila service-list (verify services are up)

step.para: Continue creating a share. OCTAVIA-MGMT-NET can be used as PRIVATE_NETWORK in this example.
step.screen: &prompt.ardana;manila share-network-create --name demo-share-network1 \ --neutron-net-id PRIVATE_NETWORK_ID --neutron-subnet-id PRIVATE_NETWORK_SUBNET_ID &prompt.ardana;manila create NFS 1 --name share2 --share-network demo-share-network1

section.title: Troubleshooting
section.para: If manila-list shows share status in error, use storage aggregate show to list available aggregates. Errors may be found in /var/log/manila/manila-share.log

if the compute nodes do not have access to &o_sharefs; back-end server, use the manila-share service on controller nodes instead. You can do so by either running sudo systemctl stop openstack-manila-share on compute to turn off its share service or skipping adding "manila-share" to compute hosts in the input-model (control_plane.yml in /var/lib/ardana/openstack/my_cloud/definition/data).
